meanings.definition: In a state of nervous excitement or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She felt overwrought before her big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The overwrought child couldn't sit still in the waiting room.
meanings.sent3: The overwrought puppy barked at its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: His overwrought mind raced with irrational fears.
meanings.sent5: The overwrought student bit their nails during the exam.

meanings.sent1: The overwrought design had too many unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: Her overwrought explanation confused the audience.
meanings.sent3: The overwrought cake had too many layers and decorations.
meanings.sent4: The overwrought plan fell apart due to its complexity.
meanings.sent5: The overwrought painting overwhelmed the viewer with its intricacy.

meanings.definition: To make too elaborate or complicated.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overwrought her essays with unnecessary words.
meanings.sent2: He overwrought the proposal, making it hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overwrought the dish with too many spices.
meanings.sent4: The author tends to overwrought his stories with unnecessary subplots.
meanings.sent5: The tailor overwrought the dress with too many embellishments.
